data.title: Great atmosphere, Taco's to die for.
data.text: Got great service and the food was wonderful.  Had the Oaxaca Black Mole Shrimp Taco and it was the bomb.  Draft beer and good food.

data.title: Good place for lunch.
data.text:
Food was OK not great. Salsa bar with a verity of salsa. Small
Place. Good for lunch. Alcohol served. Not a fine dining experience for evening dining.

data.title: Unique environment, Great service and Phenomenal food!
data.text: My older brother gets the credit for locating this gem! Met up with him along with my other brother and niece for dinner. The staff was extremely friendly and always checking in on how we were doing and if we needed anything. The food was amazing! My Asada Taquito and Pastor Taquito was phenomenal! Tried a bite from everyone's plate. Which included The Gaucho Burro and Pacific Plate- just as amazing and phenomenal a my Taquito's. Reasonable priced + superb service + unique atmosphere = a great experience and wonderful night out with family.

data.title: Great spot in Glendale
data.text: Finding a place with good Southwestern-style food isn't a problem in Phoenix/Glendale. But La Santisima was incredible. Ordered the steak quesadilla and savored every second of it, along with rice and beans. Plus a salsa bar, so I was always munching. Only downside is you have to pay extra for your next scoop of chips. Oh well, I was stuffed anyways. Friendly service, not bad prices, why not?

data.title: Great Cochinita Pibil
data.text: We were in Playa deal Carmen in November where Cochinita Pibil originated and this was as good as anything we had there.   Flavor was spot on, meat was very tender and not fatty.   The burro was outstanding.   The chicken mole was also superb!   Not being a big eater, I got 2 street tacos:  the chicken mole and the tinga which was good but not exceptional.   The Quesa is quite an interesting dish - not at all last quesadilla but more of a turnover packed with the filling of choice,   Very good.   The salsa bar is outstanding!   Our only regret is they didn't have the al pastor so we couldn't try it.   Would recommend this place highly to anyone loving real Mexican food.

data.title: Fantastic tacos
data.text: If you want a place that has something a little different La Santisima is the place. They have a wonderful salsa bar that has salsas I have never heard of, but taste out of this world. It's a small place, with great food.

data.title: Worth a Visit!
data.text: My husband and I decided to try one of the restaurants in Phoenix written up by Diners, Drive- Ins & Dives.  The gourmet Taco Shop was close and sounded good, so we stopped in for an late lunch/early dinner. This is a small restaurant with limited parking in front of shop. We were readily seated and brought a basket of chips. The Salsa Bar offers lots of options from mild to hot. The menu has many unique taco combinations as well as other choices. We both got 2 different tacos that were delightful!  I especially enjoyed the unique flavors in the pork slow cooked I think in banana leaves. Everything we had was delicious and we will plan to return when back in Phoenix!

data.title: Wow!  It was so good!
data.text: We found this restaurant on TripAdvisor and are so glad we did!  It is VERY small, but VERY good!  We started with their chips & salsa.  The salsa bar is wonderful!  It was fun to try each one and decide which were our favorites.  We then had their Margarita Classica - only $3.00 each, and sooo good!  My husband ordered the Plate Tlaloc Veggie Taco dinner (cactus!) and I had the Plate Pacific Taco dinner (chicken).  Both were excellent!  Our server, Karina A. was a sweetie and handled many tables efficiently at the same time!  Highly recommend this place!  Don't let the smallness of it scare you away!

data.title: Amazing Mexican Food
data.text: After eating at LaSantisima in Phoenix, we wanted to try the Glendale site. It was wonderful too. We started with fantastic margaritas. While waiting for our burritos, we sampled all the kicking salsas in flavors we had never heard of.  What a memorable meal.

data.title: Super Authentic Mexican
data.text: Super authentic Mexican. Location is not great and exterior is not inviting but food is fantastic. They have a salsa "bar" with a large selection of salsas for you pre-meal chips - if you like heat you can find it here. Prices are very reasonable.

data.title: A little different than other options in Phoenix for Mexican food.
data.text: First time at this relatively new location.  If you like avocados do give their guacamole a try.  Very chunky and unique.  One disappoint was that they were out of horchata on the evening we visited.  Generous portions.  The vegetarians in our group were pleased with their options.  Minor quibble -  a couple of their chairs could stand to be reupholstered.

data.title: Great Mexican food, excellent presentation, flavor, quite unique!
data.text: We were a little bit spooked by the Day of the Dead art and effects surrounding the dining area, but were delighted with the excellent Margaritas, and outstanding regional mexican dishes, fabulous flavor and presentation.  The service needs some work however, spotty at best.

data.title: Atypical
data.text: Different approach than standard Sonoran, but their tacos are very good. Arguably the best salsa bar in tow, but be ready to pay for extra chips, which I think is fair. Recommend anything with their quality melted cheese, eg quesadillas

data.title: Great mexican food
data.text: This is not your typical Mexican food. They have Marlin tacos Argentine steak tacos plus many others. The food is tasty and good. They also have a great selection of Salsas at there Salsa bar. They serve beer and alcohol. My husband as nd is not a big fan of Mexican food and does not go out of our area usually to eat,but he will come here and really  enjoys this food. It's not cheesy Mexican food.

data.title: Great Tacos and Burros
data.text: Different than your usual Sonoran Mexican food.  Very good tacos and burros.  The rice is excellent and I usually don't like the rice served with Mexican food.  Many different sauces/salsas to try with your chips or dinner. All are excellent!  But beware some are HOT.  Everything I have had has been delicious.  Highly recommend.

data.title: Great Little Restaurant
data.text: The food is really good here. Delicious flavors in everything that I have tried. They offer many different salsas with pecan being my favorite. I highly recommend this place.

data.title: Very Unique restaurant
data.text: Gourmet Taco shop is an understatement. The biggest problem of the meal is deciding what to order.  Many, many very delicious options. Doubt there is any restaurant like this in Phoenix or Arizona for that matter.  Actually there are two locations, in Central Phoenix and Glendale.  They provide chips and a salsa bar where you can choose your own salsas to your liking.  Each very tasty.  Then comes the main course very carefully prepared with fresh ingredients.  We've gone several times and each time has been fantastic.  We've tried different menu items with varying excellent well prepared flavors.  We've never had or tasted food like this before and would highly recommend it.

data.title: The real mexican dish
data.text: Try the Quesadillas and Tacos, they are the best in valley. The place is small but packed with flavor and great people, during meal times you might have a little wait.

data.title: not your typical mexican food
data.text: Not your typical Mexican food restaurant. My husband had a smoked Marlin Taco and a Beef Mole Taco. He loved it. I never seen him eat Mexican food with such gusto. He even ate his rice and beans. I had Oaxaca black Mole Quesa.I am not a fan of mole , but I really enjoyed my meal..They have a Salsa bar with a great variety of salsa. You can get creamy cilantro salsa to strawberry salsa. They also have a great horchata served with fresh fruit in it. This place is a great fine. Beer and alcohol served as well. I know we will be back the menu is quite large. We have a lot of food to try...

data.title: Amazing flavors
data.text: Unbelievably delicious!!! I went to the Phoenix Taco Shop on 16th st. I can still taste the amazing flavors and its been two weeks!! Highly recommend!
